label: Data Sources Disclosed
description: Indicates that the data sources for this visualization are known and listed.

label: Open Data
description: Indicates that the visualization uses publicly accessible data, which can be downloaded, verified, or reused.

label: Dataset Linked
description: Indicates that a link to the dataset is provided with the visualization.

label: Data Citation
description: References a published work that describes or validates the dataset.

label: Raw Data Available
description: Indicates that unprocessed material (e.g., images, scans, text) is accessible.

label: Trusted Data Source
description: Indicates that the data is from a source the author deems reliable or reputable.

label: Dynamic Data
description: Indicates that the information is refreshed regularly or continuously, so the chart may change over time.

label: Data Up-to-Date
description: Indicates that the dataset reflects the latest available data.

label: Data Quality Constraints
description: Indicates that the data has known limitations.

label: Analysis Constraints
description: Indicates that the data analysis process has known limitations.

label: Missing Data
description: Indicates that parts of the data are missing.

label: Contains Modeled Data
description: Indicates that some or all of the dataset is derived from algorithmic modeling.

label: Contains Predictions
description: Indicates that some or all of the data represents future predictions with inherent uncertainty.

label: May Contain Bias
description: Indicates potential systematic distortion from collection, sampling, or modeling processes.

label: May Contain Noise
description: Indicates that random variation or measurement errors may be present.

label: Heterogenous Data
description: Indicates that the visualization merges data from diverse sources, e.g., text, images, or sensors.

label: Human Survey Data
description: Indicates that the data comes directly from individuals’ statements or surveys.

label: Derived Data
description: Indicates that the visualization shows data created by algorithms or processes.

label: Manually Collected Data
description: Indicates that humans actively gathered or annotated the data (e.g., via observations or coding).

label: Sensor Data
description: Indicates that data is captured by physical instruments (e.g., sensors, lab equipment).

label: API-Based Collection
description: Indicates that data was retrieved via an API (e.g., social media or open-data endpoints).

label: Collection Period Specified
description: Indicates that the timeframe of data collection is specified.

label: Data Creator(s) Attributed
description: Identifies the individual or team responsible for collecting the dataset.

label: Adapted Elsewhere
description: Indicates that the same data or visualization was reused by third parties. This can be a sign of endorsement and validity of the data or visulization.

label: Multiple Data Sources
description: Indicates that datasets from multiple origins were combined, likely with some aggregation.

label: Single Data Source
description: Indicates that the visualization relies on data from a single source.

label: Missing Values Handled
description: Indicates that missing data had been treated by some method, e.g., by imputation, deletion, or a any other custom method.

label: Outliers Removed
description: Indicates that extreme values were excluded or adjusted, possibly affecting distributions or variance.

label: Binning Applied
description: Indicates that continuous values were grouped into categories.

label: Data Normalized
description: Indicates that values were scaled or standardized (e.g., min–max, z-score) for alignment.

label: Tokenization Applied
description: Indicates that text was split into discrete tokens (words or subwords) for analysis.

label: Part-of-Speech Tagging Applied
description: Indicates that each token was labeled with a grammatical function (e.g., noun, verb).

label: Features Extracted
description: Indicates that additional features (e.g., word embeddings) were created from raw data.

label: Stemming Applied
description: Indicates that words were reduced to their base forms, removing morphological variations.

label: Stopwords Removed
description: Indicates that common filler words were removed to emphasize key terms.

label: Analysis Tools Attributed
description: Indicates that data analysis was done using a stated, available tool.

label: Automatically Labeled Data
description: Indicates that some or all labels in the dataset were generated automatically.

label: Random Sampling
description: Indicates that data points were selected using a purely random or probabilistic method.

label: Stratified Sampling
description: Indicates that subgroups (strata) were identified and then sampled proportionally.

label: Systematic Sampling
description: Indicates that data points were chosen at regular intervals.

label: Cluster Sampling
description: Indicates that entire clusters were used as sampling units.

label: Alternative Units as Reference
description: Provides a secondary unit or scale to clarify the primary measurements (e.g., kilometers vs. miles).

label: Complex Units
description: Indicates that this visualization contains units likely unfamilar to the intended audience requiring explanation or reference points

label: 95% CI Error Bars
description: Indicates that 95% confidence intervals are displayed; out-of-range values are still possible but less likely.

label: Actual Time Offset
description: Indicates that the chart’s latest timestamp lags behind real time.

label: Time Range Selected
description: Indicates that data is shown only for a chosen timeframe, excluding earlier or later periods.

label: Data Filtered
description: Indicates that data was included or excluded based on specific conditions or statuses.

label: Geographically Filtered
description: Indicates that the dataset is filtered by geographic criteria.

label: Demographic Filter
description: Indicates that data was filtered by demographic attributes (e.g., age, gender).

label: Data Manually Removed
description: Indicates that some data points were intentionally removed for specific reasons.

label: Can Sort & Filter
description: Indicates that viewers can reorder or filter data for a custom view.

label: Aggregated Data
description: Indicates that values were combined or averaged, which may hide variation.

label: Simpson's Paradox
description: Indicates that aggregated data can mask or reverse trends visible in subgroups (Simpson's paradox).

label: Correlation ≠ Causation
description: Reminds viewers that observed correlation may not imply causation.

label: Major Finding
description: Indicates that the visualization presents a key or central result.

label: Adjusted Baseline
description: Indicates that a non-zero or shifted reference point is used (e.g., per capita, moving average).

label: Possible Visual Artifacts
description: Indicates that the visualization algorithm or scaling method may produce patterns not present in the underlying data

label: Rounding Errors
description: Indicates that data in the visualization may contain rounding errors, e.g., values not adding up to 100%.

label: Mind False Conclusions
description: Warns the reader that a seemingly obvious visual pattern may lead to false conclusions

label: Shows Top N
description: Indicates that only the top N elements are displayed, based on a certain criterion.

label: For General Audience
description: Indicates that this visualization was designed to be easily understood by a general audience without domain-expertise, i.e., that it might make some simplifications or ommits some complexity

label: For Experts Only
description: Indicates that the chart requires specialized or technical domain knowledge.

label: For Policy Makers
description: Indicates that the chart is primarily aimed at government officials or decision-makers, the visualization contains very condensed, high-level information.

label: Public Domain Visualization
description: Indicates that the chart is free of copyright restrictions.

label: <X> License
description: Indicates a specific license governing the chart’s distribution.

label: Public Domain Data
description: Indicates that the dataset is free from copyright or usage restrictions.

label: Data: CC0 Dedication
description: Indicates that the data is under the Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication (CC0).

label: Data: ODC-PDDL
description: Indicates that the dataset is licensed under the Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License (PDDL).

label: Attributed Visualization Creators
description: Indicates that the individual or organization responsible for creation is acknowledged.

label: Sensitive Topic
description: Indicates that the chart covers a sensitive topic that may upset some viewers.

label: Technical Terminology
description: Indicates that the visualization uses domain-specific terms that may be unfamiliar to many.

label: Terminology Explained
description: Indicates that definitions or clarifications of specialized terms are provided.

label: Background Reading Available
description: Indicates that extra materials or readings are provided for additional context.

label: Can Mouse Over
description: Indicates that hovering over elements reveals additional details.

label: Zoomable
description: Indicates that the map can be zoomed in or out.

label: Can Sort
description: Indicates that users can reorder elements by a certain dimension.

label: Parameterizable
description: Indicates that users can modify parameters or settings.

label: Brushing & Linking
description: Indicates that users can brush or highlight elements within or across multiple visualizations.

label: Details-on-Demand
description: Indicates that details appear when elements are hovered or selected.

label: Interactive Pre-Filter
description: Indicates that the data is initially pre-filtered but can be manually adjusted.

label: Device-Responsive
description: Indicates that the chart adapts to different screen sizes and aspect ratios.

label: Non-Area-Preserving Projection
description: Indicates that the chosen map projection does not preserve consistent area proportions.

label: Points Don't Match Exact Locations
description: Indicates that symbol positions on the map may not reflect precise coordinates

label: Points Match Exact Locations
description: Indicated that symbol positions have exact coordinates for the event.

label: Uncertainty Visualized
description: Indicates that statistical or model uncertainty (e.g., error bars, confidence bands) is shown.

label: Uncertainty Omitted
description: Indicates that known uncertainty is not shown in the visualization.

label: Dual-Axis Encoding
description: Indicates that two different (vertical) axes are used to represent separate variables in the same chart.

label: Truncated Axis
description: Indicates that an axis starts from a non-zero point, explaining the rationale for that

label: Inconsistent Axis Intervals
description: Indicates that intervals on the axis are not uniform, potentially confusing scale perception.

label: Inverted Axis
description: Indicates that an axis direction is reversed with respect to an otherwise intuitive direction, e.g., higher values on the top, time passing from left to right, etc.

label: Differing Y-Axis
description: Indicates that multiple charts use different y-axis scales or baselines.

label: Log Scale
description: Indicates that the data is plotted on a logarithmic scale.

label: Size Distortion
description: Indicates that element sizes may not strictly match their underlying data values.

label: Small Values Exaggerated
description: Indicates that very small data points are magnified for better visibility.

label: Invisible Small Values
description: Indicates that extremely small items may not be visible at the current scale, e.g., they cannot be seen at the current screen resolution or zoom level.

label: Overlapping Elements
description: Indicates that elements can overlap in dense areas.

label: Colorblind Safe
description: Indicates that color choices remain distinguishable for colorblind viewers.

label: Printer Safe
description: Indicates that the design remains clear and readable when printed

label: Area Encoding
description: Indicates that the size of visual elements is calculated as function of their value mapped to the area.

label: False Friend
description: Indicates that a visualization may resemble a common visualization yet might require different interpretation

label: Null-Values Removed
description: Indicates that null or infinite values have been excluded from the data.

label: Varying Scales
description: Indicates that multiple adjacent charts use different axis scales, complicating comparison across charts.

label: Rainbow Required
description: Indicates that a rainbow-like color gradient is required to show the specific data.

label: Redundant Encodings
description: Indicates that more than one visual channel (e.g., color and shape) encodes the same attribute.

label: Labels Omitted
description: Indicates that axis text is provided in accompanying descriptions rather than on the axis itself

label: Composite Index
description: Indicates that a combined metric synthesized from multiple factors is displayed

label: Qualitative Categories
description: Indicates that data is grouped into descriptive categories (e.g., high, medium, low).

label: Approximate Times
description: Indicates that the displayed timeframe is approximate.

label: Estimated Geographic Boundaries
description: Indicates that shapes or borders are inferred rather than exact.

label: Uneven Time Intervals
description: Indicates that the intervals between time points are inconsistent.

label: Known Data Gap
description: Indicates that there is a known gap in the dataset.

label: 3D
description: Indicates that the chart visualizes three-dimensional or volume-based measurements. The chart may contain occlusion.

label: Experts Involved
description: Indicates that domain experts provided insights or guided the design and analysis

label: AI-Generated Visualization
description: Indicates that the chart was produced by generative AI tools (e.g., GPT, DALL-E).

label: AI-Generated Data
description: Indicates that part or all of the dataset was generated by an AI model.

label: AI-Assisted Analysis
description: Indicates that AI methods (e.g., clustering, pattern recognition) were used in data analysis.

label: AI-Generated Captions
description: Indicates that descriptive text or annotations were produced by an AI system.

label: AI-Derived Insight
description: Indicates that the key insights rely on AI-based evaluation.

label: Human-Verified AI
description: Indicates that humans verified AI-generated results.

label: Possible AI Bias
description: Indicates that the visualization may reflect distortions introduced by AI systems

label: No AI Involved
description: Confirms that no AI was involved in creating this visualization.

label: Secondary Data
description: Indicates that the dataset is derived from secondary or aggregated sources rather than raw data.

label: Data Off the Map
description: Indicates that some data points lie outside the current view and are not displayed.

label: Semi-Auto Data Processing
description: Indicates that data processing involves both machine automation and manual cleaning.

label: Additional Manual Cleaning
description: Indicates that the data processing was cross-checked manually.

label: Irregular Patterns
description: Indicates that there are irregular patterns that may not yield meaningful conclusions.

label: Standard Scale Used
description: Indicates that the visualization uses a standard scale (e.g., linear).

label: Interval Breaks
description: Indicates that an axis in the visualization has one or more breaks, i.e., unequal intervals.

label: Positionless Elements Not Shown
description: Indicates that this visualization does not or cannot show elements without a geographic position.

label: Simplified Geographic Boundaries
description: Indicates that geographic boundaries have been simplified to improve readability of this visualization.

label: Interaction Linked Across Multiple Views
description: Indicates that interactive changes in one view affect other views (e.g., linked small multiples).

label: User-Tested Vis
description: Indicates that the visualization was validated through user testing (e.g., user study).
